body: Given that the `WatermarkGauge` is not super critical, I'm ok with changing it to a `volatile long`. If the `OneInputStreamTask` should fail again with a similar problem, then we know that the used JVM is affected. I'll update the PR accordingly.
Thank you @yanghua and @zentol. Merging this...

Thanks for the fix @AlexanderKoltsov! 
I'll merge this.
the code is modified  using a similar  http approach as the metric aggregation. please help me review the PR.

This PR can be closed as it will be addressed by FLINK-9714.
Thanks, Fabian

This PR can be closed. PR #5491 added a TableSource that supports nested JSON data.
Thanks, Fabian

> According to the DefinedFieldMapping interface the field mapping can also contain the input fields. However, the Kafka table source factory was calling SchemaValidator#deriveFieldMapping with its own schema instead of the the input type.

to the commit message

Thanks for the review @zentol. Merging this PR.
I know that the legacy handler will be de removed, but in the production, if the parallelism of the operator is  bigger, it is diffculty to track the watermark problem by the flink ui.
LGTM, except the one remaining indentation problem mentioned by @zentol .
cc @dawidwys and @pnowojski
hi @rileyli Thanks for your contribution, but I think just refactor the naming style is not very necessary and it is not "typo". cc @zentol @tillrohrmann
hi @patricklucas thanks for your contribution, this PR contains two commits, is the "hotfix" commit related to FLINK-9806? if not, I suggest split the commit into a single PR.

The "hotfix" was a necessary modification to the dev-only helper scripts for building the docs locally. I assumed that it would just get squashed into the main commit when being merged, though I can do that too if it's required.

I don't think it's really deserving of its own issue/PR.
we can keep the hotfix in this PR but it shouldn't be squashed into the main commit as it is unrelated.
Maybe @twalthr you can have a look at this?

Thanks for your contribution @rileyli. Even though this change seems rather trivial I would like to discourage these kind of contributions. The problem is that it does not add much additional value at the cost of introducing subtle bugs (e.g. variable name clashes). Therefore, I would like to ask you to close this PR.
@zentol I have addressed your comments in a new commit. Can you look into it please?
Duplicate. Close.
LGTM, +1

PR #6392 fixed this issue.
Thanks for the review @StefanRRichter and @zentol. Will fix the indentation while merging.
cc @zentol
Thanks for verification and reporting issue!
Thanks, merging

@zhangminglei  For your interest - there is a new Bucketing Sink in the Flink master (called `StreamingFileSink`), with a different design: Managing all state in Flink state (so it is consistent), with a new File System writer abstraction to generalize across HDFS, POSIX, and S3 (S3 still WIP) and with a more pluggable way to add encoders, like parquet and orc.

As an example, we added a Parquet writer, which is quite straightforward and flexible with the new interface.

Would be great to get your opinion on that and see if your ORC writer code also works with that.
If it works out, the new StreamingFileSink could replace the current BucketingSink.

@twalthr I've addressed most of your comments. Thanks a lot for the detailed review.

However, now it seems like the Elasticsearch 6.x IT cases are failing, due to ceased support of Elasticsearch embedded nodes for Java unit tests. I'll have to look a bit more to see how that can be fixed. Will ping you when that is addressed.
@twalthr  Have updated the PR and looking forward to your comments.
New metrics should be documented in https://ci.apache.org/projects/flink/flink-docs-master/monitoring/metrics.html#kinesis-connectors.

Hi @yanghua, thanks for the update. I'll merge this. BTW, there's no need to squash the commits after a review .
@xccui  can you review `TO_BASE64` function?

This exception is also ever caused in our large-scale applications, and we increase the `taskmanager.network.request-backoff.max` in cluster level to make it well.

I agree with keeping the current default value in codes because it may delay the unit tests or itcases if increasing the value. Then the config can be adjusted based on job or cluster level if user meets this exception.

Maybe we can register the task in network ASAP during running, for example, put `registerTask` in front of blob cache process, that may avoid the unnecessary failover in most cases. :)
I found the last cause of test flakiness and successfully ran this about 30 times on `flink-ci`, will merge now.
merging.
Streaming HA tests are now failing: https://travis-ci.org/zentol/flink-ci/builds/408391945

I've run those tests in flink-ci and they all pass: https://travis-ci.org/dawidwys/flink-ci/builds/408396629

Merging.

thank you for your comment. As Calcite 1.17.0 released and I found more things to be fixed especially relating to the test. As soon as I finished will mention all Calcite's tickets because of which some changes in  Flink's code are required.
What is better? to close this PR and create a new one or continue here?
Hi @yanghua, I wonder if you could rebase the PR and apply the changes mentioned in former PRs. Thanks!

I've reverted the sleep between the jobmanager restarts, as waiting for job to run was not sufficient to ensure a checkpoint was taken. I've run those tests multiple times in flink-ci(https://travis-ci.org/dawidwys/flink-ci/builds/408423871) and they pass now. @zentol could you have another look?

@kl0u @twalthr could you please help review this pr?
In other word, I have one more question: If I need to add a test that`KvStateSerializer#deserializeStateDescriptor` throws `ClassNotFoundException`, if yes, if there any test I can refer.

I think this is still valuable, since it's a much simpler way to achieve this goal. While troubleshooting, asking a user to configure slf4j-reporter imo is asking a bit too much. 

But maybe somewhere down the road we could drop `MemoryLogger` and add some shortcote code that would setup slf4j-reporter correctly when `taskmanager.debug.memory.log` is set to true?

_much_ simpler? You just have to copy a jar from /opt to /lib and copy&paste this into the config:
```
metrics.reporter.slf4j.class: org.apache.flink.metrics.slf4j.Slf4jReporter
metrics.reporter.slf4j.interval: 60 SECONDS
```
Merged

@twalthr Really sorry about my careless. For this PR, I just want to push as soon as possible, because it is mid-night in China, so did not check carefully, sorry for that. Now, it has been updated, please review it again.
Actually, I have contributed to table module recently and implemented five functions, they are `fromBase64`, `toBase64`, `log2(x)`, `ascii`, `chr`.
`ascii` and `chr(char)` is a pair functions in many RDBMS to exchange ASCII code and character(string).
 The purpose is I want to enhance Flink table/sql's functions. I know there are some functions more important, I will try to implement them in the future.

Isn't this meant for the case where you want to change the `BucketID`, so you actually need the reinterpretation?
but the bucket ID type is already defined in the constructor. you can't just change that.
CC @azagrebin

I think the Builders are done wrong. Instead of reusing the builder, the builder should be immutable and each call should return a new builder that has fields from the old builder and the new value that the user wants to set. This way we don't need to reinterpret. WDYT?

Hi @cjolif, @twalthr, this PR is ready for a second pass now.

- End-to-end tests now pass stably.
- Addressed all of @twalthr's comments
- As for @cjolif's comment on custom configuration for the REST client, I addressed this by introducing a `RestClientFactory` that offers opportunity for the user to tweak the `RestClientBuilder`
- I also decided to use a Builder pattern for instantiating the `ElasticsearchSink`. Along with the new `RestClientFactory`, we would have yet more constructors, so I felt that using a builder pattern would be a better idea for the future.
@aljoscha I've reworked the builders. This introduced a small gotcha for tests; if you set the `bucketFactory`, and afterwards change the type the factory is overridden with a default factory.
that's better now
Shall we also change the PR's title?
Now that we're on the file sink ...
